class_notes: Texts will be Lucretius (c.90-55) De Rerum Natura and Vergil (70-19) Georgics, a 'didactic' poem on 'farming.'  Both texts claim to be didactic, but both transcend their remit, offering contrasting insights into the nature of things. Readings in Latin and English translation; critical essays old and new; two hour exams, short papers, final exam or paper.
course_description: Reading of selected passages from the Eclogues, Georgics, or Aeneid, with discussion of poetic forms and strategies.
sections: Class Nbr: 3863, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 2:40-3:55p, Instructor: E. Master, Status: Open
